how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
putting it all together, what value does: I consider Tiddlywiki to be an almost perfect "knowledge database", where I can piece together and interact with webs of information.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver);Single-file wiki third-party mobile app (e.g. Tiddloid, Quine)
how do you back up/sync changes between: TiddlySpot / TiddlyHost;Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox);WebDAV

outside of plugins, palettes and other i: If a given TiddlyWiki is mostly used as a place to "dump" information in, then hardly no customization. The more time I spend interacting with it, the more it will be customized.
what are we doing well? prompts for thin:
The organic feel of the development is reassuring, as is the wide range of people and backgrounds involved in both project and community. Especially with Jeremy as helmsman for the project.
The "teaser" filter functions for JSON data handling that we got a year or two back got me VERY excited and hopeful for more.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
I don't see any plausible scenario where I would drop TiddlyWiki and/or the community.
I think I saw that there will be some semi-"official" delegation of work on developing subsystems to certain people, which to me sounds like it could make project management easier for Jeremy.
The main thing stopping me from contributing to the project is that, even after using TW for more than 15 years, I still feel like I'm not competent enough...
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
